name: Coal conveyor system; Manufacture; For surface mine, at point-of-sale; 1.83 m belt width
description:
This process is part of the NETL Unit Process Library.  To access the library and the original dataset:
1) Navigate to the NETL LCA home page (http://www.netl.doe.gov/lca)
2) Then navigate to the “Unit Process Library” 
3) From the library, the unit process of interest can be found either through the "Complete Listing of the Unit Process Library link" or through the link to the "Unit Process Database" spreadsheet
4) For each process, a Data Sheet (DS) and Data File (DF) are available

BRIEF DESCRIPTION
This parameterized unit process is based on manufacturer's specifications, a conveyor system, 1.83 m (72 in) width, from Sandvik to transport coal from prep facility to loading silo at a Powder River Basin coal mine. Materials include cold-rolled steel, hot-dip galvanized steel, and rubber.

GOAL AND SCOPE
The scope of this unit process covers the materials required for the construction of a single conveyor system with steel cords needed to transport Powder River Basin sub-bituminous coal from the preparation facility to the loading silo, where the coal is loaded into railcars and transported to the energy conversion facility. The process is based on the reference flow of 1 piece (pcs) of steel-cord conveyor system, as described below and shown in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section below). The steel-cord conveyor system is assumed to be constructed of cold-rolled steel, hot-dip galvanized steel, and rubber; quantities of other material types are assumed to be negligible.

This construction unit process for the steel-cord conveyor system is combined with other pieces of equipment used during coal preparation on site, under Life Cycle (LC) Stage #1, in an individual assembly unit process, Coal mine equipment assembly; Production mix; Surface coal mine, Powder river basin, U.S. This assembly unit process quantifies the fraction of each piece of equipment needed under LC Stage #1 to produce 1 kg of Powder River Basin coal ready for transport (LC Stage #2) to the energy conversion facility (LC Stage #3).

BOUNDARY AND DESCRIPTION
A visual representation of the boundary of this unit process is available in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section below). Emissions related to the physical assembly of the steel-cord conveyor system (e.g., emitted while putting together the components of the conveyor system, including transport of those components) are not considered in this study. Upstream emissions from the production of raw materials used for the construction of the steel-cord conveyor system (e.g., steels) are calculated outside the boundary of this unit process, based on proprietary profiles available in the GaBi model. As discussed above and shown in the associated documentation (referenced below), the steel-cord conveyor system constructed in this unit process is incorporated into the construction assembly for LC Stage #1.

The total weight of a steel-cord conveyor system was readily available, but reliable data for the material breakdown of steel-cord conveyor system were not. The steel-cord conveyor system is designed such that it transports the sized coal from the preparation facility to the loading silo. The specifications found for the conveyor system included information for the cold-rolled steel , hot-dip galvanized steel, and rubber.

Relevant properties and assumptions used to calculate the amount of steel plate contained in a single steel-cord conveyor system are given in the associated documentation (referenced below). Total weight for one steel-cord conveyor system was calculated to be approximately 1,064,007 kg (1,172 short tons).  The associated documentation also contains additional information regarding: modeled input and output flows and calculation methods.

This process contains one or more surrogate product flows as replacements for proprietary product flows used in the NETL Unit Process Library.  All surrogate flow were taken from the U.S. Life Cycle Inventory Database; a list of surrogate flows used in this process is provided below:
1) Acrylonitrile-butadiene-styrene copolymer, resin, at plant

This process contains one or more surrogate product flows as replacements for proprietary product flows used in the NETL Unit Process Library.  All surrogate flow were taken from the U.S. Life Cycle Inventory Database; a list of surrogate flows used in this process is provided below:
1) Cold rolled sheet, steel, at plant
2) Galvanized steel sheet, at plant

CITATION AND ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTATION
This document should be cited as: 
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2015. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process: Coal conveyor system; Manufacture; For surface mine, at point-of-sale; 1.83 m belt width. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: September 2015 (Version 01). Retrieved on [DATE] from [URL for this dataset].

This dataset is part of the NETL Unit Process Library.  The Library offers additional information concerning this dataset in the form of a Detailed Spreadsheet  Documentation (DS) file and a Process Documentation File (DF).  The DS file  is an Excel file that contains all of the parameters, inputs, and outputs for a given system as well as background data, calculations and quality scores.  The DF file is a PDF document that contains major assumptions and data sources that are the basis for each unit process.  The NETL Unit Process Library is located on the NETL website (netl.doe.gov) under Research / Energy Analysis / Energy Trends and Issues / Life Cycle Analysis / Unit Process Library.

This dataset was converted directly from the DS with additional supporting information provided by the DF.  Full citations for the DS and DF are given below.

DS File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2010. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process: Steel-Cord Conveyor System, 72", Construction. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: February 2010 (version 01). Retrieved on 6/30/2014 from: http://www.netl.doe.gov/File%20Library/Research/Energy%20Analysis/Life%20Cycle%20Analysis/UP_Library/DS_Stage1_C_Steel_Cord_Conveyor_72in_2010-01.xls

DF File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2010. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process: Steel-Cord Conveyor System, 72", Construction. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: February 2010 (version 01). Retrieved on 6/30/2014 from:  http://www.netl.doe.gov/File%20Library/Research/Energy%20Analysis/Life%20Cycle%20Analysis/UP_Library/DF_Stage1_C_Steel_Cord_Conveyor_72in_2010-01.pdf

category.name: Bit. Coal and Lignite Surface Mining

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This data set is representative of best available public data from 01/01/2008 to 12/31/2008 and is not subject to limited usability within sub-time spans (e.g. summer, winter).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The scope of this unit process covers the materials required for the construction of a single conveyor system with steel cords needed to transport Powder River Basin sub-bituminous coal from the preparation facility to the loading silo, where the coal is loaded into railcars and transported to the energy conversion facility. A visual representation of the boundary of this unit process is available in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section in the Description field). The steel-cord conveyor system is designed such that it transports the sized coal from the preparation facility to the loading silo. The specifications found for the conveyor system included information for the cold-rolled steel (Steel cold rolled (St) [Metals]), hot-dip galvanized steel (Hot-dip Galvanized Steel [Metals]), and rubber (Styrene-butadiene-rubber (SBR) [Plastics]).  Further information regarding the technology modeled in this unit process can be found in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section in the Description field).
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: All elementary and technosphere flows are calculated on a functional unit basis. Calculations involving combustion primarily to generate useful work are done using lower heating values (LHV) and calculations involving combustion primarily to generate useful heat are done using higher heating values (HHV). Unless explicitly stated in the associated reference documents applicable calculations assumed standard atmospheric temperature and pressure (SATP).

processDocumentation.intendedApplication: This is a gate-to-gate manufacturing process and can be used for any type of LCA study.

parameters.name: Tot_rubber
parameters.description: [kg] Total weight of rubber for conveyor belt - weight per meter times belt length

parameters.name: Galv_st_wt
parameters.description: [kg/m] Weight of hot-dip galvanized steel per meter of conveyor system, includes steel cord within b

parameters.name: Tot_cold_st
parameters.description: [kg] Total weight of cold rolled steel for conveyor system (idler rotating parts and return idler ro

parameters.name: Tot_galv_st
parameters.description: [kg] Total weight of hot-dip galvanized steel for conveyor system (steel cord, idler frame & bracket

parameters.name: Rubber_wt
parameters.description: [kg/m] Weight of rubber per meter of conveyor belt, calculated

parameters.name: Tail_pulley
parameters.description: [kg] Weight of tail pulley for conveyor system,

parameters.name: Belt_length
parameters.description: [m] Round-trip distance conveyor belt travels to transport mined coal from mine site to stockpile po

parameters.name: Cold_st_wt
parameters.description: [kg/m] Weight of cold rolled steel per meter of conveyor system, includes rotating parts of idlers a

parameters.name: Drive_pulley
parameters.description: [kg] Weight of drive pulley for conveyor system,
